comments.body: The file contains a BOM (Byte Order Mark) which can sometimes cause issues with certain editors. Consider removing it if not necessary for your environment.
Extra '>' character at the end of the XML comment. This can cause issues with documentation generation.
Accessing a dictionary with an assumption that the key exists can cause runtime exceptions. Use 'TryGetValue' to handle cases where the key might not be present.
The 'size' property is private. Consider if it needs to be accessed outside the class. If not, the encapsulation is fine, otherwise consider exposing a public method or property.
The 'DeleteRecursively' method returns a tuple that might be hard to understand at a glance. Consider using a named tuple or a separate class to make the code more readable and self-explanatory.
